4V9yUh7Po77zrHsBjlInwg.text: Awesome cocktails. Great beer in pewter tankards. Try the cheese straws. Haven't tried the £600 cognac yet

Xuhy75uV1UvNbW01f4q4LQ.text: Horrible service. There were 8 open tables on a Friday night and we were told the only available seating was available outside in the station. Needless to say the hostess was incredibly rude and our servers outside took a long time to get our food. Waited about 30 minutes for our second round of drinks!

c5XNCzxuEyvARurun89BSw.text: This is most certainly not a cheap bar, but I think that as long as you turn up armed with this knowledge, you are unlikely to be disappointed.The ornate setting is a fascinating feature in itself to anyone who remembers when this was a real booking office, as just a few short years ago this was one of the most dilapidated areas of the station. This has radically changed, and it's now a sophisticated 'hotel bar' style cocktail lounge with low lighting and decorative windows that have been beautifully restored.Those windows look out on to the station concourse, where you can view the famous kissing couple statue as well as Eurostars and their passengers coming and going.There is an excellent selection of (pricey) wine here, and staff will be more than happy to top up your glass as you enjoy a drink. Cocktails are, I'm told, very good too. Just don't order too many!

LsZPana3wxS1QPP1UcWamw.text: My boyfriend took me here to celebrate a special occasion. It's a stunning venue and the bar has a fun, buzzy atmosphere. The music is quite loud and that was fine for pre-dinner drinks but we moved to a quieter table for dinner.I had the smoked salmon and blini starter followed by the grilled halibut and both were very tasty. The wine was also delicious and I've been told the gin martinis are spot on. All in all I had a wonderful evening but I do feel it's over-priced.

g-yIiwCcBwREySUa6CGGNg.text: Very expensive indeed but a beautiful old part of the station refurbished very well. Service is excellent. There are cheaper places to drink but considering were one is, I suppose it is to be expected.

AD4dHu_wSrqQ79DWXT7vtA.text: Great location, service and ambiance!My friend and I stopped in to the historic Booking Office restaurant at the absolutely stunning St Pancras Renaissance London Hotel. Seriously this hotel is amazing with soo much history and attention to detail, but that is for another review...The restaurant in bar is set in the back of the hotel with direct access to St Pancras station. Being inside the station and with direct access to Kings Cross station brings in an eclectic crowd. It was fun to people watch and see people coming in from Brussels or Paris.The bar and restaurant is set in a Victorian feel with low light - making the feel inviting yet cozy. A mix of small and large tables and benches fill the room. A large bar wraps around one side of the restaurant - which I was told was actually the old booking office for the station way back when (hence the name). You can even see the old booking office windows behind the bar. The restaurant offers an array of cocktails, wine, champagne and beer. The menu is not extensive, but there is something for everyone. I enjoyed the mushroom butternut squash risotto. The dish was presented well and was light yet filling. To top off the night I enjoyed the Chocolate fondant cake with vanilla ice cream. The sponge cake was filled hot chocolate amazingness! I would highly recommend.All in all - if you are looking for a quick stop for a drink or dinner at the station this is definitely the place to be!

kPtULwl1j2V-aMDv9kraTg.text: Great bar in the St Pancras Renaissance. Food was solid and service was good.

N5tqPoEiaT01T6AjnamflQ.text: Just to let you all know that this is the most costly place I have ever been in.Here is my story.I knew it would be expensive, but I had to visit as it is a bar selling real ale.I asked at one end of the bar, the price of a half pint of real ale, can't remember the name but it was only 4.1. The young lady behind the bar didn't know, but went to ask a colleague. She came back with £3.60, for a half pint!! But I had to have one so I could report. I had to go to the other end of the bar to order it and the price had gone up to £3.94. I queried the difference and was told that the other person had got it wrong. I told them that I would report it on web sites, but as he wasn't wasn't the manager, it seemed he didn't care. I did ask the manager and was told that there is a 12% service charge. What sevice? I went to the bar my self and got the drink. I will not be going in there again, but maybe they don't want real ale drinkers, just tourists who will pay over the odds. I wish there was a minus star, because I would give minus 2, it would be lower, but it is a very smart place.On another note, I hope Meantime Brewery are getting a bigger payment for their ales.And that is the end of my taleThank you for reading.

8kiCi2MfcVV5vdHmO3v54w.text: Just to clarify my rating, the service was 5 star plus and the food was 2 star.It was set in an atmospheric old building and the service was impeccable.  Everyone we encountered was friendly, chatty, attentive, efficient and polite.  But the food was very disappointing.  Duck Liver Pate (£8.50) was bitter and lacked flavour, but Cornish Crab Cocktail (£12.50) had fresh meaty crab and was tasty.  St. Pancras Cod & Chips (£18) was very disappointing.  The cod was watery, and the batter was greasy and soggy.  The chips were excellent:  crunchy outside and fluffy inside.  Strangely, they served crushed flavourless peas instead of mushy peas.  Rib Eye Steak (£28) completely lacked flavour as it was not char-grilled.  With that price tag, we expected a perfectly-grilled (not pan-fried), decent, flavourful steak.  It came with grilled tomatoes and grilled inedible mushrooms (dry, bitter and with cardboard texture).  Chocolate and Pistachio Cake (£8.50) was not a cake but a mousse.  It had beautiful garnishes which completely lacked flavour, but the chocolate ice cream was creamy and tasty.  Blueberry and Almond Bakewell Tart (£8.50) had undercooked base, but the filling was OK.  It came with wonderful creme fraiche sorbet.  Their cooking standard was well below the price tags.I think it is a perfect place to have a couple of drinks in a sophisticated yet relaxed and friendly atmosphere.  The bartender was very friendly and informative.  The selection was great.  You will be well taken care of by the excellent staff.

LlDQhM5k8InnSa5fmowtdw.text: 4* Food & ServiceService was impeccable even though we weren't guests of the institutional hotel.The moment I walked in, the concierge rushed to help me with my bag up three steps. Had to shoo them away since I was fine with the bag.I was out at the lobby area for a business meeting. We ordered drinks, lunch and dessert.I got the sticky toffee with clotted cream and (non alcoholic) ginger&lemon drink.My colleagues had:The salmon dish which looked fabulousSandwich also looked greatOur meeting was about 2.5hours long but since we kept ordering food & drinks, they left us alone.The coat room was convenient as well as I had to lug my luggage around.

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Outside facade
Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee
Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Ginger & lemon drink and their own brand of sparkling water!

PBt9kP2ntlMm72x9mUztMA.text: I'd give this place a 4 or 5 star rating based on the decor and food, but the service is so poor, it's gotta be a 3. Ambience is utterly gorgeous. Would be a good venue for a date, or to take some out-of-towners. I love the gothic spires, wooden accents, arched windows and artful interior lighting. Drinks:  Cocktails slightly pricey at £12 each, and to be honest, tasted good but none of  the mixes were anything brilliant.  (note: I haven't had any of the warm drinks mentioned in another review, which might be superior).Service:  Slow with attitude. Yawn. Why am I paying for people who don't seem to care at all about serving? I had to get up twice to get hold of my waiter; once I went to the bar myself to order drinks as I couldn't find anyone to serve me. And even after I'd ordered it took a while to get the drinks on, which seemed odd as the bar appeared to be well staffed. Food: Absolutely amazing, very impressed.  The sea bream tasted so fresh it must have been swimming that morning. The halibut looked stunning; visual presentation of all dishes was excellent (4 of us went for dinner), and the portions were well sized. £20 for a main is money well spent here. Visually the place is fabulous, and the location is super convenient. But that doesn't make up for bad service.

P-g3GNunay0gnydeT4LleA.text: Was actually staying at the connected hotel so very convenient to pop down for a bite and drink. As other have mentioned the ambience is amazing. The breakfast buffet is pretty decent. There's a wide selection of food from eggs benedict, fresh fruit, cured meats, etc. your pretty standard fare for a 4-5 star hotel breakfast. The best part is after hours drinks. The cocktail menu items are exciting, different and taste delicious. Definitely recommend coming here for drinks.

yqqbJ2I0bmkK8GLrqKre-Q.text: If you ever want to feel classy, then put on your best tie and shirt and head down to this place because you will feel like one classy mofo sipping on your beer or wine while nibbling on hors d'oeuvres (is this ok to say in England?).The mood here is great and it's a very nice and quiet place to bring your sexy lady and treat her right here like a proper gent. It does come with a higher price but it's totally worth it. Seating is limited but that's because the space is wide and spread out for optimum privacy in conversation yet intimate because of the lighting. They serve food but it's best to go here for something light and drinks and head on over somewhere else just as fancy to impress that girl you like (or that guy).Service is top notch.

6x-ZU93CHHUR6pg1HeIReQ.text: Swanky joint. The steak I had was ok, a bit over done, but the peppercorn sauce saved it a bit. The tripple fried frittes were good. Solid. The drinks were good... and even when one of the drinks was spilled all over the place they took the time to come over and clean everything up and re-fill the drink. The staff came over with great care and delicacy. It was really of them. The bar itself is superb. High ceilings, exposed brick, ginormous windows overlooking the platforms. Very cool place.

5Gq6K0AOsQ0tjozmFOSwFQ.text: Had the vegetarian English breakfast, I expected at least one vegetarian sausage in it but no, there were only loads of potato cakes , and they tasted very blend, not as nice as I expected. But the hall was just amazing, amazing old train station looking interior! 5 star for the environment!

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Vegetable English breakfast

9ZRWI4h483jJ_nlVghFP_g.text: Great bar in the Renaissance, St Pancras Hotel.  Stunning architectural features from the original old station.  Ceilings that were almost cathedral like in detail, high and vaulted, and they played to this characteristic beautifully by uplighting the ceilings with dim, soft red lighting.  The service is very attentive and accommodating.  Excellent champagne and the best Dark and Stormy I've ever had!

AsrfVAfxLn1vsA4wsTFUrg.text: Oh Booking Office, let me count the ways...From your amazing(ly strong) drinks, well prepared and lovingly put in my hands to the beautiful cheese strews and snacks, you had me with me first step in. A cocktail will cost around £11.50 but the taste is out of this world. If you head over on a cold winter's day you will find some delicious homemade hot drinks to keep you warm. A warning to those who have never been: Thursday and Friday tends to be pretty busy so don't expect a seat or you will be left unhappy. Many will wander up to the bar, drop their stuff and camp out for an enjoyable time.

90cNBKnX8Jb3mRvAxvBVPw.text: Recently had a business meeting at The Booking Office. First of all, the place is stunning, set inside the old St. Pancreas station, it is an extraordinary fusion of classic Gothic architecture and modern accents.The food, while pricey (what isn't in London), was equally impressive. I went for the BLT & chips while my partner had the gnocchi. We were both happy.The music was good and the overall vibe excellent. I don't drink, but the beverage menu even had me considering trying something!We've already re-set two more meetings here. If you're nearby, definitely stop in. On Friday's and Saturday's, word is it gets pretty crowded, so make a reservation!

VcJsi7-XnJXr_KCZ6KlIsg.text: Great drinks inspired by English legends. Amazing Victorian architecture centered around the train station. Very impressed...

d_VCn7beF7Gjjb0L7zwpeA.text: The decor is awesome at this restaurant/bar in the Renaissance St-Pancras hotel (part of the Marriott chain).   The drinks menu and selection is very good, and enjoyed the beer in a metal mug - reminded me of the old cartoon Robin hood!  I thought the service was kind of slow, and the food was ok.  Good spot to have a drink before going to bed or for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. The fish n chips
Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful old building

fn0BRy52QxyyvZNVjpJ0CA.text: Great food and drinks but (old lady alert) very noisy due to the acoustics of the beautiful architecture.

yvEefW9LhSJHGDWptH10cA.text: This place was great. I was a guest at the hotel and so had dinner there the night of my arrival.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The atmosphere is very comfortable.  The menu was appropriately varied; and there was a decent selection of wine by the glass.  I started with the goat cheese, beet and watercress salad which was so good!  Probably the best I have ever had, and I get this salad any chance I can.  For an entree I had the chicken which was good, but nothing spectacular.  For dessert I had the chocolate fondant which was fantastic.  I would go again when next in London. The only reason I gave it 4 starts instead of 5 is because I think that - as a solo diner - I may have been forgotten about.  It took a long time for my chicken to come, and when it did, it had cooled off a bit.  Fortunately, I was not in a rush.

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. goat cheese, beet and watercress salad.  Fantastic!

NxwMCIVLXJHO8us9wJvtXg.text: Bit strange that within one hotel there could be such a difference in quality of service. The venue is lovely but it totally lacks in ambience with the almost disco like feeling of loud music and flashing red lights. Surely there are enough bar-clubs in London?!The food is uninspiring and the waiting staff rude and pushy.

Nn0ix-uli3rh8hvAJYMdWw.text: This bar is attached to the St. Pancras Renaissance London Hotel, which is a luxury hotel at the St. Pancras international rail station.  Basically, I'm telling you, it's not just another pub (although they do serve versions of some pub favorites.)We came for drinks and a late-night bite to eat, and since we were guests of the hotel, it's very convenient.The place is fantastic!  It's an historic landmark that literally used to be the booking office for the old train station.The food was good, but even if you're just going for drinks, try their "chips", the best we had in London.As for drinks, my wife liked their Mojito's but they garnished my Manhattan with an orange peel that threw the drink off, at least for me.Definitely drop by, if you're staying at the hotel, or just passing thru the international station.

RVC7BD-5ziYvfLl2pEtaoA.text: First the positives: The atmosphere here is great and the staff are lovely - the right level of attentiveness without being over bearing. However, the reason for only two stars is this:the breakfast menu stops at 11am on a saturday, with no brunch type options on the menu. This is a shame as they have 4 sandwich options and I'm sure a breakfast-type one wouldn't be too difficult to add. I tried to order the "daily special" (though they are listed, by day, on the menu) and was merely told "we don't have it". There was no reason given such as the fact that it was sold out (though that seems unlikely at 12noon), and no alternative was offered. We both settled on the £13 steak sandwich. The steak was cooked as we ordered, which is good, but it was still very tough. I don't think it was that high quality. The chips were very good though! I'd love to go back to the foyer bar rather than the booking hall to try that, as it looked much better Value. Also, the staff outside the Gilbert Scott were very helpful in telling us all about the building, so that may be worth shelling out for.

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

7l-oXbvaO4nwSo7g0VqKQg.text: I'm a casual kind of girl, I never feel that comfortable surrounded by suits, kitten heels, and wine lists who's prices go into the 3 number mark. Basically, I am not The Booking Office's target clientele. Nonetheless, I came here a few weeks ago for a pre-meal weekday drink. They were hugely busy and fully booked but made room for us for almost an hour which was lovely. Staff were friendly although we were the only customers not in suits!The bar is beautifully designed, with lots of dark wood, staggeringly high ceilings and beautifully patterned menus. The chairs were huge and comfy. The draught beers are served in silver tankards and the beer list, while short, is more than acceptable. I went for a Meantime Pale Ale, which is always delicious, I think it was a half pint. For £6.50, it's not cheap (but I wasn't paying!) and it was a really lovely place for a drink.

FQjLMGor3dyLbTciwRY9YQ.text: I love this bar, it is a lovely place for late night chill out and have conversation with friends. I could not have chance to have proper dinner here but always enjoyed its music, ambience, beers, cocktails  and welcoming service. If I am not mistaken, they open 24 hours.

vT5hzAedotRwYyfKOImVQw.text: The atmosphere here is stunning.  The old booking office at the station, high ceilings, wood paneling, railway clock, brick and windows looking onto the platforms.  They have plenty of tables with cushy seats (many of the clientele on a Friday eve were making out).Anyhow, the food was disappointing.  A bit pricey (14 pounds for a burger or sandwich) and the menu was quite limited.  The burger was dry and bland and the fish cakes were very fishy.  The chips were good.They had a lounge singer there on a Friday night, and the crowd can be quite tourist-trashy.  With very little options in the area, it is a nice place to grab a drink or a quick snack and relax into the atmosphere--I think it might be more desirable in the afternoons.

x7CVxJ3dfyoKJg5LtKI7BQ.text: We called in for lunch. This restaurant has a superb location where the architecture is as amazing as the food. The high ceilings, ornate brick and stonework look out over the magnificent arch of St Pancras International Railway Station where Eurostar trains sit poised to head off to Paris, Amsterdam etc and all continental Europe.Our waitress, Veselina, was attentive and personable. I ordered a chicken liver parfait followed by pork belly with mashed potatoes and Brussel sprouts. My partner had the Niçoise salad followed by a chicken dish.All was first class, washed down with a glass of local beer.If you are in the area this is a must see place. The bill was reasonable, as a gratuity charge is included.Next time we're in town we will return.

5jaaBAw9OGmB4bgeaEzjEw.text: Came here for lunch on the whim after going to Saint Pancras station. The 40 foot high ceilings and Gothic decor are impressive. The tables are small but sufficient for all the food we ordered. We ordered the cappuccino which excellcomes with a little chocolate wafer floating on the foam.  The cappuccino come with wee little, round pale butter cookies that were quite tasty. We ordered the duck nuggets with ketchup, the ham hock pizza with morels, fish and chips, and tiramisu.  Pizza had a tangy tomato sauce which paired well with the ham and mushrooms.  Duck nuggets were deep fried, and were ok, Not Great. Fish was ok as well, slightly underdone towards the middle. Loved the pea mash and yellow horse radish sauce.  Free WiFi. You will feel pampered with the service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

JyGeHit2eWx9oin2ImQ_kg.text: Difficult to get a table at the mainly empty bar on a Tuesday night. Many tables were reserved but sat empty the whole hour and a half we were there. The cocktails were simple and a bit pricey. Service was pretty slow even though they seemed to have multiple waitstaff.

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

VS-Uc7SFMfvWWI5Q0M6-qQ.text: We came here to try the special Harry Potter drinks I had read about. However, the staff here weren't too knowledgeable about the drinks. I really want to see the spectacle of the cocktail creation. I wanted to try the most themed drink. I ordered the Butterscotch Brew but I thought would be like the famous Butter Beers like at Universal Studios, but this was nothing like it! First off, it's a hot drink and most importantly, it was disgusting. The server came over to ask us how we liked the drinks and I told her that honestly, I didn't care for it, but unlike in the States where staff would try to offer a remedy, the reply was pretty much, well yeaaa.. As if she knew the drink was awful or that she straight up didn't care. This was not great service. The location itself is pretty cool though, but the extremely pricey digesting drink was a HUGE mistake. This is definitely NOT worth the spurlge. :(

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Pricey cocktails

QX90f_5vE1pZmwV_GliWhw.text: We are staying at a nearby hotel so we came here out of convenience for dinner for our last night in London. The restaurant is in the lobby of the St. Pancras hotel and adjacent to the St. Pancras train station with the same windows and vaulted architecture of the station. They don't really have regular dining tables, they were more tables and chairs made for cocktails and a lounge, yet many were here for dinner. The restaurant is also really dark and loud at night, the music was more in synced with a nightclub than a dining room. The food was delicious. We enjoyed the fish and chips which was authentic and served along with a tasty pea mash. Others in my party enjoyed the 28-day old dry aged steak, pork chops and venison. It was unfortunate the space was so loud, dark and our table was too small to really enjoy the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips

d6s5lRbYW1zaGyY_0jYpYg.text: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the St. Pancras hotel for our honeymoon.Long days walking about in London called for early nights, and unfortunately we never got a chance to have dinner or even a nightcap at The Booking Office. On our last day in London, however, we were out of bed early enough to grab breakfast and a coffee down at the proper (but not so quaint) 'hotel bar'.I would say at the very least you must give the Breakfast a shot. I had the berry pancakes and my wife got the Eggs Benedict - I would order them both again, however the coffee was our favorite part. This was by far the BEST latte we had on our entire trip to Europe.If you don't get a chance to eat or drink here, I hope you've at least taken the time to marvel at the 40' high ceilings and fascinating decor. Well done, Renaissance.

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. St. Pancras Renaissance Hotel
Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Best Latte!

lMt_VresWsABFErQKSeOkg.text: Form over function, this is in the "lobby" of the St. Pancras Hotel. You get to eat and drink adjacent to the active train station while enjoying the towering, vaulted ceilings of the station's Gothic Revival architecture. It's a place to see and be seen. Cocktails are pricey at  £14 and up and I thought they tasted a bit weak, though the selection of house cocktails was extensive with some novel recipes. The beer tap list, however, was severely lacking. Table service at least was quick and friendly. We came later in the evening so were here for drinks only and didn't try any food. Overall, the ambiance is the real draw here. But the high prices and lower drink quality would force me to not recommend.

09_W3XO-hXmmiBueJ-ry-A.text: With one night to stay in London and the end of our holiday we decided to take advantage of what we had been told was a great place to go and booked dinner at The Booking Office! I can't say enough about the food, staff and atmosphere. Ralph our waiter was very friendly and was happy to share his excellent knowledge about the hotel and railway station history. We were there on "punch" night where we watched as a well attired barman prepared an exotic Charles Dickens punch and shared it around the restaurant and bar patrons!! It was a memorable night. Go for dinner you should have a great time, we did!

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

5F2qQjJ7uKwVZ73svNUgIw.text: Ended up here inadvertently after arriving in St Pancras earlier than expected and Gilbert Scott was so full, I didn't want to even try for a one person space. Booking Office was happy to seat me and was even so kind as to save the high top table for me after I wandered off so that I could come back to where I was first shown. It was a deceptively large space. Now, on to the cocktail. It was a play on a negroni but was based on a smokey tequila, basically a mezcal. I was recommended this drink by the server and was not disappointed. I took my time with the drink because it was sent even better over time with the ice melting and releasing some of the flavors. I would definitely recommend even if it's the weekend and it looks packed and busy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

cEddPwn605mI-QFzvtqWOA.text: A bit fancier than my regular haunts but a fantastic atmosphere and great service.  I popped in for a light diner and was quite happy with my meal.  Get the truffle chips!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

nIuG4zVOGEeZwnmsk8c21g.text: Everyone knows the staff can make or break a restaurant experience, so I want to start off by commending The Booking Office and their staff for providing excellent services. My coworkers and I enjoyed a nightcap at The Booking Office for three nights in a row and each visit we had the pleasure of being served by Narcissus. She was polite and professional, passionate and knowledgeable. She seemed genuinely interested in engaging with us and we enjoyed discussing all sorts of topics as she waited on our group. She did a fantastic job of making a group of Americans feel very welcome and at home across the pond! We were sad to miss her on our last night, but would recommend anyone request her if you're heading to The Booking Office for a drink.  I have had the pleasure of staying at the St. Pancras Renaissance Hotel on two business trips now and The Booking Office is definitely one of the best parts about staying at this property. It is conveniently connected to the St. Pancras Train Station (and is adjoined to the lobby of the St. Pancras Renaissance Hotel). Walking into The Booking Office sends you on a journey to a different era. You enter from the station through two glass-paned, weathered and wooden doors with brass pull handles and enter a modestly yet comfortably lit, spacious yet cozy interior with cathedral-like ceilings and Victorian Era flare, the feel of which is made all the more effective by the tangy scent of tobacco in the air. You're always greeted with a friendly smile, and the staff overall is very professional and accommodating. From the breakfast buffet to the expertly crafted cocktails, I began and ended almost all of my days at The Booking Office and the food and drinks were consistently well crafted and delicious. Wonderful experience all around!

y94pnILXumeSwqnCW94CIQ.text: Very nice atmosphere!! The drinks are a little more expensive than other places but it's something you expect from such a nice establishment and it's completely worth it for the experience. This is a great place to go grab some drinks with some friends and sit around and talk for a couple hours. And even a great place to take a date. They also have finger foods to snack on if you're feeling hungry. Overall great place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Delicious whiskey sour

E8J0NQsjA6oJ7gzZaPboYQ.text: We came and enjoyed a pricey cocktail and some bar snacks. Great service and such a lovely atmosphere. They had live music on which added to the ambiance. If you have an adult Harry Pottery fan on your hands, I'm sure they would love a visit here following your Platform 9 3/4 photo opp.

5lm69nDR8Um0hBWZ6j9NLw.text: A wonderful place to meet up for pleasure and business.The service is usually fantastic, however the odd occasion I have experienced a rude hostess/ waiter.

onmjnxYai9qz5SP8IFjpEA.text: Expensive but tasty drinks. Service was good, seating was nice, and a great location to catch up after a long day exploring the city.

wLGhWjtFM687V1dvgxFxBQ.text: I confess I was a little sceptical of this place beforehand - not only was this a bar in a hotel, but also in a train station. It can be tough for such bars to show character, so I suppose my expectations were fairly low.I needn't have worried - it turned out to be a gorgeously dramatic venue for start-of-the-night drinks. It really is all about the high arching ceiling and gothic spires - just be careful not to walk into anything whilst you're gazing upwards!I arrived first (unusually for me!) to find it almost full on a Friday evening. The front-of-house lady seemed a little reluctant to help - simply telling me they were full for drinks reservations. I gestured to a nearby empty high table against the wall in the bar area and asked if we could sit there, at which point she hesitated, seemingly because it was set for 2 people when I'd asked for 3. I solved this perplexing dilemma with the revelationary idea of moving a spare chair from the next table over. Original, right? And was only then allowed to sit down. Not sure why she couldn't have helped me with that...?The cocktail menu is a real beauty, partly taking inspiration from the Victorian era surroundings. It also takes a while to read through, so if you're thirsty go with the opening-at-a-random-page approach! Particularly as they took a very long time to mix - we were waiting at least 25mins for our three choices after ordering from the table. I was happy with my Ring of Roses when it finally arrived though - a floral treat of vodka, rose cordial, lavender essence and champagne.We didn't stay for food and I feel it's more of a statement drinks place anyway, before going somewhere cosier for dinner. Prices come in around the £9-12 mark, and if your wallet doesn't stop you drinking here all night then the waiting time per cocktail probably will! Otherwise a happy cocktail stop so long as you're not in a rush...

-upuuf7nIxpB9nkNiaKwNQ.text: Fabulous hidden gem! 1st floor near international departures from St-Pancreas station. What a lovely environment in which to relax! The Gin & Tonic menu was perfect, Caesar salad with quail eggs and anchovies perfect and great fish and chips.

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Perfect G & T

JBrKETZB38qTKlcg4jfZGQ.text: Stayed at the Renaissance for two nights.   Had a fantastic breakfast experience the first morning, followed by one of the worst on day 2 when (after a 20 minute wait) they tried to pass off an over-cooked burnt pile of eggs as an omelet (see photo).   Inconsistency is typical of many hotel restaurants and this one contributes to that rule.

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Burnt egg disc (a.k.a egg-white omelet)

udFjs6v6quZc2EPcnREFew.text: Service a little slow but the drinks are delicious. We had a Missionarys Downfall and some gin sling thing and would drink many of both. Love the decor - nice mix of modern and traditional. Didn't eat but the mini burgers looked real good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

o7r3ovjuOTmUPNYZYtk0vQ.text: Buzzy bar in a beautiful building, the staff are lovely, very relaxed and chatty even though it was very busy. Lots of place to sit but most tables seemed to be reserved. The cocktails were amazing, we just had snacks but they were delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of The Booking Office Bar & Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
